benchmark_details.name: MOLE (Metadata Extraction and Validation in Scientific Papers Using LLMs)
benchmark_details.overview: MOLE is a framework using Large Language Models (LLMs) to automatically extract and validate metadata attributes from scientific papers covering datasets of multiple languages, including Arabic, English, Russian, French, and Japanese.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To automate the extraction and validation of metadata from scientific papers, enhancing research discovery and reproducibility.

data.source: 126 annotated scientific papers covering datasets in multiple languages.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on matching extracted metadata with ground truth in the annotated papers.
methodology.interpretation: High precision indicates fewer hallucinated values, while high recall shows accurate prediction of existing metadata.
methodology.validation: The annotations were verified by two authors to ensure consistency.
